actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to permit the payment of supplemental security income benefits to individuals in publicly operated infirmaries and other publicly operated community residences, without regard to the 16-bed limitation presently applicable.

summary.text: Amends Title XVI (Supplemental Security Income for the Aged, Blind, and Disabled) of the Social Security Act to permit the payment of benefits to individuals in publicly operated infirmaries and other publicly operated community residences, without regard to the presently applicable limitation on the number of residents served by such institutions.

titles.title: A bill to amend title XVI of the Social Security Act to permit the payment of supplemental security income benefits to individuals in publicly operated infirmaries and other publicly operated community residences, without regard to the 16-bed limitation presently applicable.
